definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
to follow/to adhere to/to abide by
ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in

sentences.english: Are policy makers ready to do what it takes to break this vicious circle?
sentences.chinese: 決策者們準備採取措施打破這種惡性循環碼？

sentences.english: The process becomes a self-reinforcing feedback loop.
sentences.chinese: 這個過程將成爲自我強化的惡性循環。

sentences.english: To break this vicious circle, it is essential to promote development in drug-growing regions.
sentences.chinese: 爲了打破這種惡性循環，必須促進毒品種植區的發展。

sentences.english: Yet how could the habsburgs escape from this vicious circle ?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，哈布斯堡如何才能逃脫這種惡性循環呢？

sentences.english: The result is a feedback loop that accelerates local warming.
sentences.chinese: 其結果是一個惡性循環，加速局地的暖化。

sentences.english: A circle, in other words, is not necessarily a vicious circle.
sentences.chinese: 循環並不一定是惡性循環。

sentences.english: That could drop local governments into a vicious circle of cash strains.
sentences.chinese: 這可能會讓地方政府陷入資金緊張的惡性循環。

sentences.english: This vicious circle must be broken somehow,” Urani explained.
sentences.chinese: 無論如何必須打破這一惡性循環。

sentences.english: And so the vicious cycle begins.
sentences.chinese: 就這樣，惡性循環又開始了。

sentences.english: This can be a dangerous cycle.
sentences.chinese: 這有可能成爲一個惡性循環。

sentences.english: So the bad circulation still goes around, one more round, betting once more.
sentences.chinese: 於是惡性循環，再來一輪，再賭一把。

definition: lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
to misjudge/error of judgment/incorrect ruling/miscarriage of justice
imbalance/to become dysfunctional/to lack proper care (after an illness etc)
to produce the opposite of the desired result
